name: Arianna Huffington
title: Founder & CEO
bio:
Arianna is the founder and CEO of Thrive Global, the founder of The Huffington Post, and the author of 15 books, including, most recently, Thrive and The Sleep Revolution. In May 2005, she launched The Huffington Post, a news and blog site that quickly became one of the most widely-read linked to, and frequently-cited media brands on the Internet, and in 2012 won a Pulitzer Prize for national reporting. In August 2016, she launched Thrive Global, a corporate and consumer well-being and productivity platform with the mission of changing the way we work and live by ending the collective delusion that burnout is the price we must pay for success. Thrive Global provides trainings, seminars, e-courses, coaching and ongoing support based on the latest scientific findings to improve people’s health and increase productivity for both companies and individuals around the world.

She has been named to Time Magazine's list of the world’s 100 most influential people and the Forbes Most Powerful Women list. Originally from Greece, she moved to England when she was 16 and graduated from Cambridge University with an M.A. in economics. At 21, she became president of the famed debating society, the Cambridge Union.

She serves on numerous boards, including Uber and The Center for Public Integrity.

Her last two books, Thrive: The Third Metric to Redefining Success and Creating a Life of Well-Being, Wisdom, and Wonder and The Sleep Revolution: Transforming Your Life, One Night At A Time, on the science, history and mystery of sleep, both became instant international bestsellers.

name: Abby Levy
title: President
bio:
Abby is President at Thrive Global. Prior to this, she was a consultant to consumer product and digital media businesses, advising them on product and marketing strategy. From startup to multinationals, Abby supported clients including Hearst Media, LeagueApps, LittlePim, LiveAuctioneers, MindBody, Seedling, SideTour (now part of Groupon), Synapse and several startups pre-launch.Prior to working for herself, Abby was an Associate Principal at McKinsey & Company’s Innovation Practice and a Product Manager then Category Director at OXO International, a high growth consumer products company best known for the GoodGrips brand of kitchen tools. At OXO, Abby ran new product category development, responsible for launching over 50 products from concept, design and manufacturing to sales and product marketing.

Abby began her career at McKinsey, first as a Business Analyst in their New York Office and was then promoted early to an Associate position, working in the London Office. Abby earned her B.A. with Honors from Princeton University’s Woodrow Wilson School of Public and International Affairs and earned her M.B.A. with Distinction from Harvard Business School.

name: Rajiv Pant
title: CTO & Chief Product Officer
bio: Rajiv is the CTO at Thrive Global. Rajiv is an entrepreneur, consultant, and sought after speaker. As CTO at The New York Times, Rajiv led the successful development and delivery of dozens of acclaimed mobile and web products over 4 years. He managed a staff of 420+ which he grew from a third of its size. Before this, he headed up digital technology at Conde Nast for 4 years, where he managed multiple fast-paced, growing teams including Reddit. Admired by his colleagues as a people-person, open-minded collaborator, and approachable leader, Rajiv also enjoys writing software code. He has received several prestigious awards during his career including being honored as a Young Global Leader by the World Economic Forum in 2014.

name: Kathryn Friedrich
title: CMO
bio:
Kathryn is the Chief Marketing Officer at Thrive Global. She brings more than 20 years of sales, marketing and business operations expertise working for prominent companies in the US and abroad. Kathryn currently oversees sales and marketing for Thrive Global’s three business pillars - corporate transformation, content & media, and commerce. Kathryn recently left Google after 9 years where she led a variety of teams across sales, product and content. Her last role was leading YouTube's global monetization strategy for content development, branded entertainment, advertising and the new subscription service RED.

Prior to this role, Kathryn was Head of Video Strategy for North, Central and South America, responsible for launching video ad products and developing Google's go-to-market strategy across all countries. She started at Google running the US Media & Entertainment display sales team, working with film, television and gaming industries to develop digital marketing strategies for the largest media companies in the world.

Earlier in her career, she worked in magazine publishing where she held executive leadership roles at Hearst, Conde Nast, and American Express. She started her career as a senior financial consultant with KPMG after graduating with a Bachelor of Science from Cornell University. She currently lives in Summit, NJ with her husband and two sons, and enjoys baseball, skiing and golf.

name: Aaron Graves
title: VP of Engineering
bio: TKTK

name: Callie Schweitzer
title: Managing Editor
bio: Callie is the Managing Editor at Thrive Global. She comes to Thrive from Time Inc. where she over saw digital growth for the company's 116 brands as Editorial Director of Audience Strategy. She also founded and was Editorial Director of Motto, TIME's empowerment platform for millennial women. She was previously at TIME overseeing audience growth and engagement, social media, search, newsletters, new product initiatives and content partnerships. She is also an award-winning journalist whose work has appeared in TIME, The New York Times, Mashable, The Huffington Post and PEOPLE. She was named to AdWeek's list of Future Publishers in 2015 and to Forbes’ 30 Under 30 in Media in December 2012 and 2013.

name: Dae Hee Lee
title: Creative Designer
bio: Dae Hee is Creative Designer at Thrive Global. He is a multidisciplinary designer from Seoul, South Korea, with a passion for creating sleek, user-centered experiences that make product interaction easier and more delightful. His sensibilities are influenced by his background in architecture, and he often dives into distinct project components in Thrive Global. Before joining Thrive Global, he worked at Huge Inc., and American Express.

name: Danny Shea
title: TKTK
bio: Danny spent over ten years at The Huffington Post, where he helped build the company from a startup into the world's leading online publication. As Editorial Director, he oversaw the site's expansion into video and led high-impact editorial initiatives, including HuffPost Rise, the solutions journalism video series, HuffPost's presence at the World Economic Forum in Davos and its WorldPost conference in London. In his time at HuffPost, he executed several high-profile launches including HuffPost Live, where he oversaw eight hours of daily live news programming, HuffPost France, the site's first foreign-language edition, and the site's presence on new platforms. He began his career there as Media Editor, covering the media industry. He has appeared in the New York Times, the Wall Street Journal, Bloomberg Business Week and on NBC's "Today" show and MSNBC's "MorningJoe." He graduated with honors from Princeton University, where he studied at the Woodrow Wilson School of Public and International Affairs.

name: Dan Katz
title: Director of Business Development
bio: Dan is the Director of Business Development at Thrive Global. Previously, he served as chief of staff to Arianna Huffington at The Huffington Post, aiding in the oversight of the global media company. Prior to HuffPost, Dan was the chief researcher to David Gergen at the Harvard Kennedy School and CNN, also working to build Harvard's Center for Public Leadership. You can find Dan thriving while on a run along the East River, or performing every number from the Broadway show Hamilton.

name: Jeff Swafford
title: TKTK
bio: TKTK

name: Joey Hubbard
title: Director of Trainings
bio: Joey is the Director of Trainings at Thrive Global. He has dedicated the last 30 years to coaching and facilitating motivational seminars to assist individuals and professional organizations in improving their lives, their careers and their businesses all over the world. Joey was recently Executive Consultant and Partner for McGhee Productivity, which provides consulting and educational services to businesses to increase productivity, communication, and quality of life. Raised in urban Los Angeles, Joey rose above the challenges of the area to receive a football scholarship at UCLA and attend UCSD. He has completed Masters in Psychology and Theology. Following college he began his career as a motivational speaker and performance enhancement coach.

name: Jonathan Berger
title: Product Lead
bio: TKTK

name: Josy Blair
title: Sales and Marketing Manager
bio: Josy is a Sales & Marketing Manager at Thrive Global. Hailing from Seattle, Josy attended the University of Pennsylvania, where she studied history and art history. She most recently worked at Creative Artists Agency (CAA), building brand partnerships for Fashion, Entertainment and Sports properties. She is a competitive tennis player, though took a slight detour to play varsity squash in college. She is an Alfred Hitchcock aficionado and a classic movie buff.

name: Karolina Chodkiewicz
title: Director of Business Operations, Marketing & Sales
bio: Karolina is the Director of Sales and Marketing at Thrive Global. She is responsible for setting up processes and managing client relationships. Prior to Thrive, Karolina was part of Google NYC where she most recently worked as a Senior Partnerships Manager within the YouTube organization. Karolina was recruited by Google after completing her Business Administration degree at Lancaster University Management School in 2009. Thriving in collaborative environments, Karolina enjoys getting involved and getting things done. She is painter and photographer in her free time.

name: Kieran Dahl
title: TKTK
bio: TKTK

name: Maria Ciaravino
title: Executive Assistant
bio: Maria is the Executive Assistant to Arianna Huffington at Thrive Global. A New York native, Maria spent the last 16 years in Los Angeles executive assisting at companies such as the Carsey Werner Company and Wonderful Company. She is a Rutgers University alumni and enjoys golf and photography in her spare time. She believes in 8 hours of sleep for optimum health!

name: Monica E Lee
title: Head of Communications
bio: Monica is Head of Communications at Thrive Global. She leads all internal and external communications strategy for the company. Prior to joining Thrive Global, Monica was Vice President and Head of Global Communications at The Huffington Post where she was part of Arianna Huffington's executive leadership team. Monica led strategic communications for the global media company across 16 markets, with oversight of all corporate, business and content communications. Prior to joining HuffPost, Monica spent eight years at NBC Universal most recently serving as Director of Communications for NBC News, managing publicity and communications strategy for the network's top talent and signature programs including TODAY, Dateline and NBC News Primetime Specials. During her time at NBC Universal, Monica also worked in corporate communications and news production for TODAY.  She began her career in media in the prestigious NBC Page Program after graduating with honors from Tufts University.

name: Maya Major
title: Cheif of Stuff
bio:
Maya is Chief of Stuff at Thrive Global. She holds down the fort in business operations, HR, and finance, as well as assisting the President in her day-to-day. She feels so lucky to have joined Thrive Global back in July as one of the first 5 employees.

Maya grew up in Valparaiso, Indiana (home of the Popcorn Festival), and traveled to New Haven to attend Yale University. After graduation, she moved to New York City to join Smart Vision Labs, where she developed and led a school-based vision exam program donating hundreds of new glasses to students in the city and streamlined POS for the SVOne.

When not thriving at work, Maya loves to spend time with her older brother and parents, and is on a lifelong mission to make the perfect cup of chai.

name: Margaux McGrath
title: Director of Partnerships
bio: Margaux is the Director of Partnerships at Thrive Global. Prior to joining Thrive, she served as senior editor to Arianna Huffington at The Huffington Post. Led by her belief that sleep is the gateway to health and well-being, Margaux worked as the lead researcher on The Sleep Revolution. Margaux previously worked as an analyst in Asset and Wealth Management at Deutsche Bank in New York. She supported multiple Managing Directors in the Private Bank nationally and a diverse client base of ultra-high net worth individuals, hedge funds, and private equity firms. She facilitated client transactions across investment advisory, lending, structured products, and banking platforms. Margaux graduated magna cum laude from Georgetown University, and while at Georgetown served as the Chairman of the Board of The Students of Georgetown, Inc. (The Corp), the world’s largest student-owned and operated business and 501(c)(3) non-profit organization. In her role, she oversaw the operation and management of six subsidiary companies generating annual revenues in excess of $4 million. Margaux thrives by prioritizing eight hours of sleep every night!

name: Olivia Jorgensen
title: Social Media Editor
bio: Olivia is the Social Media Editor at Thrive Global. She was Marketing Manager at Time Inc and a Senior Brand Strategist at Capital One where she managed Capital One 360's social media accounts and the brand strategy behind the bank's customer love campaigns. While a student at Yale University, Olivia was a member of Trumbull College, a Psychology major, and a marketing specialist for Yale University Properties. Olivia is a devout believer in a nap-a-day, but when she isn't catching Zzzs, she can be found baking, exploring the NYC farmers' market scene, and walking along the Hudson River Promenade.

name: Omar Niazi
title: Lead Software Engineer
bio: Omar is Lead Software Engineer at Thrive Global. He is a seasoned software engineer with a breadth of experience in multiple industries. He's architected apps from the ground up with a variety of companies in media, publishing, travel, and technology. As a developer, Omar played an integral part in the redesign of the NYTimes.com website, and he’s worked with large organizations like Twitter and Google to help them launch interesting projects. Omar has often been a leader for the teams he’s been on, because he’s skilled at his craft, committed to solving problems, and a friendly, approachable person to work with.

name: Rachel Stern
title: Associate Editor
bio: Rachel is Associate Editor at Thrive Global. She grew up in sunny Los Angeles, and, after graduating from college, chose to forgo good weather for the hustle and bustle of New York City. She recently graduated from Brown University with a degree in Modern Culture and Media. Some of her interests include fashion, media consumption, dogs, swimming, social media, dogs, cooking, eating, and dogs.

name: Renee Wong
title: Director of Commerce
bio: Renée is the Director of Commerce at Thrive Global. She has over 10 years of experience in management advisory, implementation, logistics, and finance with the United Nations (New York), Standard Chartered Bank (Shanghai), Clinton Health Access Initiative (Malawi & New York), Merrill Lynch (New York), and KPMG (Vancouver). Most recently, she accelerated the launch of health commodity and technology products in over 30 countries as Team Lead on a joint initiative between the Clinton Health Access Initiative's Global Markets Team and the Gates Foundation. In her spare time, she loves playing squash, traveling, and reading.

name: Ruslan Tovbulatov
title: Director of Client Services and Corporate Marketing
bio: Ruslan is the Director of Client Services and Corporate Marketing at Thrive Global. After leading video product commercialization for YouTube and launching Google's SMB media agency team, Ruslan co-founded the Google BrandLab, a state-of-the-art experience center and brand consultancy. Over the past 5 years, he scaled the program to 6 centers across 4 continents, working with 225 global brands on their marketing strategies, leading to more than $400M in digital marketing initiatives on Google’s platforms. Prior to Google, Ruslan oversaw consumer research at Kantar Retail for many of the world’s largest CPG manufacturers and retailers. He is also a 30 under 30-recognized creative, a native Russian speaker, and holds a B.A. in Government and Philosophy from Dartmouth College.

name: Samantha Felix
title: Head of Audience and Analytics
bio: Samantha is the Head of Audience and Analytics at Thrive Global. She has ten years of experience running digital media strategy for companies and publishers of various sizes. Previously she was head of audience for Mic Network, managing a team of 13 people covering strategy across all platforms. Before Mic, she was the social media managing editor for Thrillist Media Group and spent five years in management consulting. Samantha has a master of arts in comparative literature and a bachelor of arts in literature from Chapman University.

name: Samantha Winkelman
title: Head of Media Operations
bio:
Samantha Winkelman is the Head of Media Operations at Thrive Global, where she collaborates across teams to create processes and growth strategies for the editorial and business arms of the media platform.

Prior to this, Samantha was at Gawker Media for over six years, where she built their advertising strategy team, worked with revenue and editorial teams to drive partnerships with key advertisers, and established processes to scale creative development. She also spent time at Redscout, a strategy firm, where she led brand and innovation projects.

Samantha’s obsessions range from beautiful design and typography to business literature about ownership mentality to insidery media tweets to cheese.

name: Agapi S
title: Title Goes Here
bio: TKTTKTKTTK

name: Dana Zucker
title: Title Goes Here
bio: TKTKTKT
